inn1.comm: a little bit of swing straightaway. Starts off with a short of a length outside off, moving further away late, Chari shoulders arms
pitches it up on the fourth-fifth stump channel and draws Chari forward. Though this one holds its line, Chari gets an outside edge and the ball goes on the bounce to the cordon
comes forward and covers the off stump before bunting it to covers
fuller ball outside off, Chari comes forward and punches it nicely through covers, nicely leaning forward, gets it off  the splice but didn't try to hit it too hard
fired outside off, steered to backward point
fires a tempter just under a set of stumps outside off, left alone by Chibhabha
short of a length, angled in to the right-hander and straightening late, blocked into the off side
back of a length outside off, some lateral movement away off the pitch, Chari hops back and covers his off stump to ride the bounce before running it down to third man
short of good length, pushes the batsman back, Chibhabha hurriedly jumps back and bunts it into the leg side field
short of a length, holding its line on the fourth stump channel, blocked solidly off the backfoot back to the bowler

sticks to the short of a length outside off ploy but fires this slightly wide, Chibha bha punches it through the covers off the backfoot. Two fielders give it a chase and a good throw is fired in at the wicketkeeper's end. Chibhabha was a tad casual in completing the second run but survives
comes forward and blocks with an open face of the bat to the off side
good length outside off, no swing, Chari comes forward and blocks to point

fuller ball, given a good slog. Picks it up from outside off and heaves it over the midwicket region. Gives it  a lot of power but the outfield is sluggish because of the amount of moisture and the ball almost stops dead, allowing the fielder to pull it back before the boundary
tries to flick to the leg side and loses balance and is struck on the pad. Stifled appeal for lbw but that was heading down leg
comes forward and blocks this length ball into the off side
good length, angling in to the pads, misses the flick and the ball clips the thigh guard
short and wide outside off, offers enough width for Chibhabha to free his arms, which he does as he flays a cut through point
some movement there. It was good length just outside off and moves away late, Chari takes a stride forward and lifts his bat to let it go to the wicketkeeper

edged and taken. It's a lovely delivery. Good length and angling in. Chari comes forward and pushes but the ball straightens before moving away late to brush the outside edge and go towards the cordon where second slip dives to his left, in front of first slip, to take a sharp catch
good length ball, pushed across on the stumps, blocked back to the bowler

superbly done by Lakmal. Fires a full ball inviting the batsman to come forward and drive. It was just at the perfect width to entice the drive and Ervine falls for the bait. Comes forward and lazily pushes at a ball he perhaps should have left alone and duly pays the price by sending through a healthy outside edge that is snaffled comfortably by second slip

another edge but this one goes wide of the cordon. It was short of good length and squared up Sikandar raza who hops back to ride the bounce. The ball goes off the outside edge down towards the third man region
left alone in the channel outside off
very full ball just outside off, no feet from Raza who comes pushes towards cover

poor shot from Raza and Zimbabwe are unravelling here. That was just short of good length and swinging in to Raza who flicks. He is in no control of it and plays it uppishly, that too, straight into the hands of short midwicket who, it seems, was there precisely for that reason
tempter outside off, pushed on the front foot into the off side
well-left. It was full and on the fourth or fifth stump channel, similar delivery to the one that got Ervine. Williams doesn't bother going after
fuller and pushed across, left alone outside off again
fuller and even wider outside off this time, not bothered with
back of a length ball outside off, stays on the backfoot and punches it firmly to covers
good length ball on the fourth stump channel, holding its line, Chibhabha shoulders arms
back of a length ball just outside off, looks to stay on the backfoot and punch it but there is not sufficient width, resulting in Chibhabha chopping the punch on to the ground
length ball, opts to go back and does so a long way across before tucking it to the right of midwicket, where the fielder makes a good diving save
good length a stump or two outside off, punched firmly into the covers region
fuller and outside off, gets forward and pushes it to mid-off and scampers through for the single. Throw fired in at the bowler's end but it doesn't hit the stumps
tucked to midwicket
stays back to a good length ball that is angling and looks to flick but inside-edges it to the pads
fuller ball on the fifth stump channel, holding its line, blocked on the front foot

ooh, beats the inside edge with an inswinger. It was on a length and just outside off. Chibhabha looks to come forward and defend but leaves a big gap between bat and pad. The ball nips back in to go past the inside edge and misses the stumps as it goes to the wicketkeeper
gets beaten after swinging wildly at a ball that is swinging away outside off
good length ball angling in, chops on the attempted slap to the ground
short of a length, left alone outside off
tucked to midwicket
back of a length on the stumps, tucked away off the hips to square leg
short of a length, angling in on the pads, tucked with the angle behind square
good length ball, angling in from a fourth-stump line, tucked to midwicket
short of good length outside off, waits for it in the crease and runs it down to third man
full and wide outside off, late movement taking the ball further away, enough to induce a comfortable leave from the batsman
back of a length ball down the leg side, looks to glance it but can't make contact and it's called a wide
bowls it on the pads from over the wicket again and Williams turns it away to midwicket
short of a length on the pads, tries to flick it away but wears it on the pad
good length outside off, moves across to cover the off stump and block, gets it off the inside part of the bat to the leg side
nearly finds the edge with an away-swinger. That was on a length and angling in, Chibhabha hangs back in the crease and sticks his bat out and the ball shoots past the outside edge
short of a length ball, waits on the backfoot and nudges it with the angle to the leg side
angling in and overpitched, Williams clips it away to the deep midwicket boundary
short of good length on the stumps, 131 kph, gets back and blocks it solidly back to the bowler

ooh! That nipped back in very sharply. It was fired from wide of the crease and was on a length. Williams senses that it is pitched well outside off and leaves it but the ball shoots back in sharply and goes to the wicketkeeper after missing the stumps, but not by much
gives some width outside off and Williams slaps but picks point
angled in, looks to tuck it but gets it on the pads and the ball goes away towards midwicket
full and a set of stumps outside off, Williams gets forward and pushes it through the gap in covers. Two fielders give it a good chase and one of them slides in to keep it to just a single

dropped at slip! It was on a length that was pushed across to the left-hander from around the wicket. Williams misjudges the line and length and shapes up for a cut, but the ball perhaps wasn't short enough to be cut and he gets an outside edge that goes to slip, but he spills it. That was a tricky one
worked down to long-on
pitched up outside off, drills it hard to mid-off
comes on to the front foot and whips it away to square leg

he's thrown it away! Again misread the delivery. Pathirana tosses it up but takes it away from the left-hander. There isn't much spin on the delivery but Williams backs away to make room as he gives the bowler the charge, taking himself further away from the ball. Doesn't make any contact and the wicketkeeper tidies up and takes the bails off. So Pathirana ends up with a wicket in his first over and the Williams drop doesn't prove to be costly
good length just outside off, moves across to cover his off stump before blocking
back of a length ball on the stumps, Mawoyo looks to flick it away to the leg side but gets a leading edge and the ball stays in the air for a while before it if fielded at third man
fuller and on the fifth stump channel, gets forward and blocks into the off side
short of a length, rides the bounce to get nicely behind that before running it down to third man

beaten! Bounce and movement there. It was short of a length and Chibhabha is rooted to the crease. No feet as he pokes at it from the crease. The ball bounces more than he expects it to and there is some late movement as well which takes the ball past the outside edge
beaten again! Short ball and Chibhabha attempts a cut but there is not sufficient room and he makes no contact as the ball goes to the wicketkeeper
full and on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler
shot! It was overpitched and Moor nails it. It was on the middle stump channel and Moor lofts it clean over long-on
runs it down to long-on
flighted just outside off, comes forward and gently pushes it to long-off
good length on middle stump channel and spinning away, defended on the front foot
brings out the cut but gets slightly cramped for room and picks out backward point
full and outside off, holding its line and Chibhabha drives it superbly from the crease. Not much movement of the feet but he makes up for it with timing and placement as he pierces cover and mid-off
short of a length outside off, gets behind it and blocks solidly off the backfoot back towards the bowler
shorter ball and Chibhabha stays in the crease and tries to cut. But there is a lack of bounce and he gets beaten as a result
short ball, way too high and down the leg side as well
very full and on off stump, blocks it to covers
short and wide outside off, angles further away after landing. Chibhabha reaches out for it and slaps it to third man
short of a length outside off, looks to drop it in front of point off the backfoot and steal a quick single. But the fielder gets around the ball quickly and they decide against it
pushes it into the right-hander from around the stumps, tucked behind square on the leg side
short of a length, fired at the pads, Chibhabha tries to clip it away but misses and wears it on the pad
works it down to long-off
on a length and attacking the stumps from over the wicket, blocked back to the bowler
good length ball that slides on with the arm, Moor tries to make room and plays it to point
fuller ball, driven to extra cover
short of a length outside off, jumps on to the backfoot and shuffles across to protect his off stump before blocking it back to the bowler
good length just outside off, pushes it gently to mid-off
back of a length on the fifth stump channel, holding its line, shuffles across and blocks off the backfoot

appeal for lbw and given! It was a good length ball that was angled in on the pads. Chibhabha looks to get his front leg across and flick it away to the leg side. But the ball straightens just a little and strikes the batsman on the pad. Sri Lanka go up in appeal and umpire Shamshuddin raises his finger. Chibhabha goes upstairs to review it, but that always looked close though it was angled in. Replays show that the ball would have hit a fair chunk of the leg stump and the on-field decision stays. Half the Zimbabwe side dismissed now
beaten first ball. Pushes at this back of a length ball without moving his feet. The ball moves away slightly and beats the outside edge
steep bounce outside off, left alone
flighted ball on the stumps, pushed to long-on
advances down the ground to take it on the full before driving to long-off
defended back towards the bowler
very full outside off, squeezes it out to covers
bowls it at a flatter trajectory outside off, driven through covers
pitched up on off stump, gets nicely forward and pushes it to covers
edged and gone. Beautiful length ball that is angled in and straightens late to take the outside edge of Chigumbura who nervously prods forward. There was some extra bounce as well on that ball
slightly short of good length just outside off, doesn't move his feet as he blocks into the covers
moves away from the good length region and rises sharply as well, left alone
back of a length, coming into the right-hander, jumps back before nudging it into the leg side
loses control as he fires a near beamer down the leg side, must have slipped out of his hands
short of a length on the stumps, waits for it in the crease before working it to mid-on
good length ball on the stumps, defends it on the front foot back to the bowler
tossed up and fired on the pads, tucked to midwicket
comes forward to defend this length ball and gets it off the inside part of the bat to the leg side
tossed up on the stumps, defended on the front foot
short ball and width on offer outside off, cut through point for a brace
comes forward and eases it down to long-on
flighted ball on the stumps, comes forward and defends

awkwardly goes up on his backfoot to negotiate the bounce on this shorter ball and makes a weak attempt at opening the face of his bat to run it down to third man but is undone by the steep bounce and the ball misses the edge narrowly
short ball, angling in to the right-handed Moor who tries to hook and can't get anywhere near it
persists with the shot ball but fires this one down the leg side so Moor isn't really unsettled
back of a length around off, defended off the backfoot to short extra cover
fires another short one down the leg side. This one doesn't get big on him as much and Moor rolls his wrists as he pulls it just off the hips behind square
slightly short of a length around the fourth-fifth stump channel, slapped away to deep backward point
gets a good stride across before drilling this fuller ball between point and cover-point
flighted on the leg stump channel, Moor goes for a big slog but inside-edges it to the pads
good length on the stumps, does not turn much, tucked away to midwicket comfortably
comes down the track to meet the pitch of the ball and drives it to long-off
slightly flatter and fuller outside off, driven
flatter ball, just short of a length, hangs back before easing it down to long-on
pitched up outside off, slashes hard at it but drills it straight to cover
fuller ball, holding its line outside off, driven to sweeper cover
good length on off and middle, drops it in front of cover point and takes off for a quick single
good length ball, looks to pick it from outside off and flick across the line but gets a leading edge that goes on the bounce to the left of the bowler
hangs back to this length ball and defends to covers
good length, nipping away outside off, Moor keeps it out from the crease to covers
length ball that moves away late, defends it watchfully on the front foot to short extra cover
fires it flat and outside off from around the wicket, defended
good length and attacking the stumps more this time, blocked
comes down the track to meet the pitch of the delivery before easing it down to long-on
flatter and on a length, not much turn, tucked off the hips to square leg
gives it a little width outside off and Cremer punches off the backfoot. Extra cover dives but can't stop the single
finds more turn from the good length area this time and Moor tries to flick it away but wears it on the pad
short of a length ball, swinging away, Cremer tries to punch away from the body and gets a thick outside edge that flies through the cordon to the third man fence
back of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot to covers
slower full ball outside off, 118kph, Cremer picks it up and comes forward before pushing it gently to covers
hangs back before punching this length ball and picks out cover
good length ball, moving away, tries to slap it but is beaten by the late movement as the ball goes to the wicketkeeper
flatter length ball on the leg stump channel, Moor picks the length up early and gets down to get in a good position for a powerful slog sweep over square leg
pitched up outside off, comes forward and eases it down to long-off for a single
flatter and fuller on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
short and wide, enough width on offer for Cremer to free his arms as he cuts through point. No protection for that shot in the deep
bowls it close to the pads, clips it away to midwicket
short of a length, punched off the backfoot to long-off
starts with a short delivery on the ribs that is comfortably pulled to deep midwicket for a couple. Didn't get anywhere near all of it
that's a better length. Full on off, coming back in with the angle. Pushed out cover
125 kph, back of a length on off. Swings back in, Moor still wants to cut. Not there for the stroke. Finds point
good change-up. Well-directed bouncer on off, Moor sways out of the line. Didn't hurry the batsman with his pace. Probably won't
signs of a slow surface. Short and wide outside off, was there to be laced through point. Moor wants that result, but all he can do is chop a cut to point
another bouncer. Using the two-bouncer strategy nicely. Moor ducks underneath
nice use of the feet, gets close and whips to midwicket who dives to his left only to parry it away for one anyway.
slog-swept for six. A tad full, lots of loop. Moor is happy with the ball, gets low and heaves the ball cleanly over wide long-on. Superb timing, a sweep-type heave
flat and wide outside off, pushed into the off side
slower delivery on the pads, worked to backward square leg
poor line, 81 kph, slow on the pads. Worked to short fine
better stuff. Straighter, on middle and leg. Wristily worked to midwicket who dives to his right, stops the ball and returns a one-bounce throw to the keeper with Cremer hurrying back
126 kph, poor line. On the pads and worked to deep square leg for one. Easily played
on the pads again, starting his inswinging deliveries too straight, off the thigh pad to fine leg
six more. Another short delivery on middle, with Kulasekara's pace, it just sits up for Moor who swivels into his pull. Doesn't bother keeping it down. Enough to clear the square leg boundary

absolutely plumb! That should have been Kulasekara's length from the start. Full and straight, gets juuust enough nip back in. Pitches on off, Moor brings his bat down in line but the ball jags back in just enough to beat the inside edge. Moor's feet were nowhere, neither forward not back. Ended up rooted in the crease and struck Moor in front of middle and leg. Easy decision for umpire Shamsuddin. A nice cameo but Zimbabwe needed more.
well bowled. Full and straight again, 127 kph. Blocked
goes short again. Don't mind that because it genuinely surprised Tiripano who was late on his pull, mis-timed to deep square leg
offcutter to start, gets some rip on that. Pitched on off, hit Tiripano in front of leg.
much fuller, 84 kph. On off, Tiripano blocks
fuller than a good length outside off, bunted to cover from the crease
full and straight, 86 kph. Blocked
88 kph, nice and full again on off. Pushed back to the bowler. All offcutters this over
another one, blocked. Maiden
lands just short of Kulasekara. Full on off, Cremer just bunts it back. Lands a foot short
good length on off, Cremer is rooted in the crease because of that indecisive length. Thick inside edge into his body

edged and just wide of wide slip. Good stuff from Kusal Perera at third man. Fullish and a tad wide. Cremer sees width and wants to flay at it, but it comes back in. Not wide enough to cut. Cremer's flash goes past wide slip's outstretched right hand
bouncer on leg, a bit high, loopy. Cremer ducks
121 kph, good length on off, pushed back
120 kph, short ball outside off. Cremer chooses to drag his pull but fails to make contact
tossed up outside off, a mis-timed slog makes its way to long-on
Crmer comes down the pitch, looking to find a run to long-on. Skewed to cover
opens the face of his bat and guides the ball to point. Wants two, but only one there
flat, full, straight. Blocked
another turning offcutter on off and middle, worked to midwicket. Wanted to play into the off side
and then goes fast and wide outside off, takes Tiripano by surprise. 117 kph. Whistles past the bat
good length on off, pushed to cover.
shortish and wide, slashed to point where de Silva misfields and allows the run to the sweeper cover
lovely channel. Just outside off, Tiripano gets behind the line to block
134 kph, good length outside off, Tiripano leaves
127 kph, bouncer outside off. Very wide, Tiripano decides belatedly to upper cut. Misses
a low full toss on leg, looking for the yorker. Clipped through midwicket for a couple. Not a bad delivery even though it went wrong
slow on middle and leg, worked down to fine leg for one
driven to the sweeper cover. Just caressed a push off the full delivery
opens the face and guides to deep point
ah, starts the offcutter too straight. Rips down the leg side for a wide. Has to start a set of stumps wider
driven to long-on. Cremer can't avoid it, deflects the ball towards mid-off. The run is easy, eventually
full and straight, worked to midwicket
straight again, slow. Nudged to square leg
full outside off, Tiripano looks to lay into his drive but skews it back to the bowler
pushes him back with a bouncer on off and middle. Tiripano gets underneath
beauty. Back to a fifth/sixth-stump line, Tiripano prods and the ball goes past
full outside off, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, 135 kph. Tiripano gets on top of the bounce and steers to point's left. Wanted two but Tiripano slips at the bowler's end while turning
another bouncer outside off, 126 kph. Cremer misses
flat on the pads, Tiripano misses his sweep, gets struck on the pad. The ball almost trickles onto the stumps off his elbow
driven to mid-on. Some hesitation but the run is compeleted
flat down leg, nudged to short fine leg
good line. Pushed through on off, full. Driven to cover for a quick single
goes to the reverse sweep but there isn't enough pace. Hits to point, where Kulasekara is quick on the ball
mis-timed heave to mid-on for a quick run
flat on off, comes back in. Blocked off the back foot
pushed to long-on from the back foot
flat on off, nudged to midwicket
short and wide, too much width. Slapped to deep cover.
drifts down leg, worked through backward square leg for a brace. Poor ball, too straight
full on off and middle, pushed to midwicket
a deft reverse lap. Flat on off, off the glove, grazes the keeper's right glove and carries towards third man for one
overpitched on off, jammed out to long-off
gets down to the pitch and drives to long-on
looking for the big hit. Gets a full delivery, smashed down to long-on. The fielder returns an awful throw which lands in midwicket's hands
a slog sweep to deep square leg
too full this time from Pathirana, driven to long-off. With the spin. Good over for Zimbabwe, building a bit of momentum
well played. Full and wide outside off, Tiripano opens the face, uses the pace and executes a deft late cut to the third man boundary
shortens the length, on middle, blocked
pull-swept to square leg. Poor ball, drops short on leg.
flight on off, full and blocked
shortish on off, shovelled to midwicket from the crease

Tiripano holes out. A big hit lands in Kulasekara's bread basket at long-on. A fuller than good length on middle, Tiripano looked to hit this more over midwicket but the ball got onto him quicker than he anticipated, resulting in the ball hitting the bat higher up. Goes straight up and easily taken by Kulasekara running in a few feet
flat on off, blocked
driven to long-off, 82 kph
well bowled. The premeditated sweep, cremer gets low looking for a big hard sweep through square leg. Waaay too full to play that so he improvises a defense with a horizontal bat
outside edge to third man
79 kph, tossed up but too full, blocked
more flight, close to off. Mumba gets forward and defends
offcutter outside off, Cremer helps it down, drags the sweep from outside to fine leg

big appeal. That looked very close. And Sri Lanka review. Whatever happens, that's a good review. Full on off, the ball deviates back in sharply. Goes past the inside edge and hits Mumba in front of middle. Misses the bat by some distance. There was hardly an appeal from the bowler. Is there too much deviation off the track? Sri Lanka need three reds for the wicket. Umpire Shamsuddin said no quite quickly. Yes, all three reds. Hitting a good chunk of the leg stump. Excellent review from Sri Lanka. It was wicketkeeper Dickwella that was persistent on the review. Mumba just prodded at that offcutter but didn't account for the spin. A tail-ender's shot, missed the line.
defended from the front foot
a massive slog sweep scurries across to the square leg fence. Shot! Tossed up on off, Panyangara gets low and nails the stroke, all along the ground
good length on off, shovelled to midwicket
nice and full outside off, Panyangara gets forward to block
Cremer gets to the pitch and jams the full delivery into his own pad
pushed to cover
85 kph, flat outside off, opens the face to guide to third man
another slog sweep, nails it to deep midwicket for a couple. Got low enough. A good stop from square leg running around to his left
phew, huge! Tossed up on off, Panyangara slog-sweeps this over midwicket for a massive six. Got low and executed. Crunchy sound
strays down leg, wide called
flatter outside off, carved to point
good length outside off, sliced with the open face to third man
slow on off, but not full so Panyangara stands and blocks

a wild slog and Zimbabwe are all out. This is the seam-up delivery outside off, Panyangara wants to heave over midwicket but the ball is quick and hurries Panyangara who gets to the ball rather late. The ball skews off the outside half and lobs straight up. The cover fielder runs to his left and takes an easy catch in front of his chest.

inn2.comm: oh dear! Panyangara, what have you done! Gets the batsman to nick first ball and he has overstepped.It was a peach. Short of a length that shapes away late and takes the outside edge which carries comfortably to the wicketkeeper. This is the last thing Zimbabwe needed defending such a low score. What an incongruous start for Zimbabwe

and de Silva duly punishes the bowler by capitalising on the free hit. It was a short ball and at an idea height for de Silva who comfortably rides the bounce and lays into a pull shot as the ball races away to the deep midwicket boundary
good length ball outside off, presses forward and defends to cover point
short of a length outside off, stands tall and punches off the backfoot to covers
good length ball on the stumps, defended
sprays it on the pads, de Silva tries to flick but can't make contact

top delivery to end the over. Cuts back in sharply from the good length region and shoots past the gap between bat and pad. Missed the off stump by not much. What a start to the chase, but no reward for Panyangara
starts off with a short of good length ball which is bunted towards mid-on
switches to a fuller length, Perera presses forward and drives into the off side
fuller ball, angling in, clipped off the toes behind square
back of a length ball that is angled down leg, de Silva tucks it off the hips and gets it just wide of the diving wicketkeeper to the fine leg fence
full ball just outside off, comes forward and caresses it gently along the ground to the long-off boundary. All class and timing on that one as he presents the full face of his bat
left alone in the channel outside off
fuller ball, driven to mid-off
length ball, picks it from the fourth-stump channel and uses his wrists to guide it to the leg side where he picks mid-on
fuller and angling in on the pads, de Silva goes for the flick but closes the face of his bat early and gets a mild leading edge as the ball goes to the left of the bowler
good length in the channel outside off, de Silva is slightly squared up outside off and gets an outside edge to backward point
short ball that is angled in on the leg stump channel, de Silva swivels around and controls the pull to the right of the square leg umpire
short ball, de Silva momentarily thinks of going for a hook but the bounce is too steep and he decides against it. He hopes the umpire will call it a wide but he decides it is just fine
steered down to third man

shot! It was short and wide and that's all Kusal Perera needs. Frees his arms and nails the slap through covers. Hops back just as he completes the shot and gets it bang off the middle of the bat as the ball races away to the sweeper cover fence
short of a length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
fuller ball, pushed across, driven to covers
good length ball on the fourth stump channel, holding its line, de Silva gets a stride across and defends it with bat very close to pad
very full ball outside off, driven firmly to covers
back of a length ball close to off stump, nips back in late slightly to cramp him for room, chops the punch to short cover
angled in on the pads, falls over as he tries to flick it and wears it on the pads
fuller ball, fires it from wide of the crease and gets it to angle in, pushed firmly back to the bowler

length ball outside off, little bit of width on offer and de Silva is on to the backfoot in a flash as he punches it through the gaps in cover. Two fielders give it a chase though and they manage to pull it back
fuller ball just outside off, Perera closes the face of his bat slightly as he pushes it back to the bowler
short ball, asking to be hit but it doesn't get up as much as Perera would have liked and he bottom-edges the attempted pull to his right thigh
short and wide, Perera cuts but doesn't get it off the middle of the bat, chops it on to covers
short ball that is angled across and gets up well, Perera keeps his bat down and doesn't offer any stroke
back of a length, fired on the leg stump channel, tucked off the hips through square leg for an easy single
hangs back to this length ball that is angled in to the pads and flicks it through the square leg region. Gets it right off the middle of the bat, so the ball easily carries to the boundary
pushes the batsman back with a short ball on the stumps, Perera hops back to ride the bounce before blocking it back to the bowler
short and wide, cut hard but straight to cover

smacked over covers. It was full and on more than a set of stumps outside off. Perera has to reach out a long way for it but gets it right off the middle of the bat as he sends it crashing through covers. Went hard at it, so it went uppishly but well over the fielder at cover as the ball races away to the cover fence
length ball on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
comes forward to tackle a fuller ball that is a long way across and gets a thin outside edge as the ball goes to third man
fired full and on the pads, fails to make contact on the flick and the ball rolls towards square leg off the pad instead
short of a length ball just outside off, tries to punch off the backfoot but it nips back in slightly late, cramping him for room as a result. De Silva works it to cover
comes down the track and the bowler accordingly pulls his length back, but de Silva manages to whack it to mid-on
short of a length ball, gets inside the line of the delivery and pulls it behind square as the ball goes to the fine leg boundary
tries to punch but chops it on to covers
shot! Too short and enough widh on offer. Perera whips it hard from outside off and does well to keep it along the ground as the ball races away to the long-on boundary
short of a length outside off, steered to backward point
harmless short ball at 128 kph, gets up just enough for de Silva to nail the pull shot to the deep backward square leg boundary
much better length, it's on a length and de Silva tucks it from around off to the square leg region for a single
short and wide, holding its line on the fourth or fifth stump channel, Perera slaps it to mid-off
full on middle and off, gently pushes it down the ground. It was very straight and nearly brushed the stumps at the non-striker's end
punched back to the bowler off the backfoot
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the pads to backward square leg
waits for a length ball which holds its line around off and blocks it to mid-on
short ball, brings out the pull shot but isn't really in control of it. Just about gets enough on the shot to get it over the right of mid-on
backs away to make room for himself but Tiripano follows him and fires it on the body, de Silva tucks it to square leg
fuller ball on the fifth stump channel, no movement, pushed back off the inside half of the bat back to the bowler

short of a length outside off, waits for it on the backfoot and tries to pull but doesn't get hold of it and ends up whipping it just to the left of the bowler. Dangerous shot as he could have been caught and bowled, although it was highly unlikely
good length ball on off, pushed to mid-off

Sikandar Raza takes a brilliant catch at deep square leg. It was a short ball and asking to be hit. Perera muscles a pull shot and swivels around but fails to keep it along the ground. The ball seems to be heading to the deep square leg boundary, but Raza who was just in front of square runs a few inches to his left and plucks a superb catch
good length ball, pushed across just outside off, presses forward and blocks into the off side

full and outside off and it's creamed through the covers. It was around a set of stumps outside off, but Dickwella took an early stride across just as the bowler was delivering which allowed him to get to the pitch of the ball, drives it between cover and extra cover
runs it down to third man
poor delivery. It's sprayed full and on the pads at a comfortable pace. De Silva clips it comfortably off the toes to the deep backward square leg fence

stays in the crease to defend this good length ball and gets it off the inside part of the bat to midwicket. They scamper through for a quick single and beat the throw from the fielder who comes charging in
short and wide outside off, stands tall and slaps it through covers. The fielder at extra cover gives it a chase but the ball comfortably beats him
back of a length ball just outside off, hops back and shuffles across to protect the off stump before defending off the backfoot back to the bowler
short of a length and angled in on the pads, tucked off them to deep backward square leg
length ball outside off, tries to get a stride across and work it across the line but can't beat midwicket
good length outside off, stays in the crease and blocks down the pitch

very tough caught and bowled chance put down! De Silva came charging down the ground in a pre-meditated move and slaps a length ball very hard to the left of the bowler who tries to get it with outstretched hands, but it deflects off his palm in a flash. The ball goes to cover where the fielder fires a needless throw and the batsmen take the overthrows

superb pull shot! Tries to bang one in on middle stump channel but it barely gets up to waste height. De Silva gets in position early and picks it up off the front foot to send it one bounce over the deep square leg boundary
follows it up with a fuller ball on the stumps which is quietly blocked
fuller and angling in on the stumps, driven to mid-on. No run there
short of a length, waits for it in the crease before steering it down to third man to bring up his fifty
fuller ball, tucked to midwicket
shuffles across early and tries to pull this back of a length ball but doesn't gt hold of the shot. Gets a slight top-edge as the ball lobs to the midwicket region

beautiful! What timing on that one! It was very full around a set of stumps outside off. No movement either, so Dickwella is able to lean forward and ease into the drive as the ball splits the gap in the cover region
short ball on the leg stump, makes a feeble attempt at a pull shot but there was never sufficient room to execute it properly and he ends up making no contact
gets forward and creams another cover drive but picks out the fielder this time
short of a length ball, stays on the backfoot to ride the bounce before punching to short cover
floated up and pushed across to the right-handed de Silva who comes forward and pushes back to the bowler
good length ball, not much turn, tucks it from the crease to midwicket
gives the bowler the charge and gets to the pitch of the ball before lofting him effortlessly over mid-on as the ball goes one-bounce over the boundary
dabs it to midwicket
comes down the track to meet the pitch of the ball before drilling it down to long-on
comes forward to take it on the full before working it down to long-on
reverse sweep. It was pushed across to the left-hander from over the wicket. Panyangara gives it a chase and manages to pull it back before the third man boundary
short ball on off stump and spinning away. De Sila cuts it late and manages to get it between point and shor third man
good length ball, waits for it in the crease before fending it off towards point
flatter ball that turns a bit, stays on the backfoot and works it through covers
flat and on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
gets an outside edge to short third man who dives to prevent the ball from going to the boundary
slightly back of a length and spinning away sharply. Dickwella plays a late cut and though the ball keeps a little low, he manages to cut it wide of backward point
flat ball, tries to cut but the ball doesn't get up as much and Dickwella is beaten
back of a length, stays on the backfoot and punches it back to the bowler
fuller just outside off, comes forward and defends
pitches it up on the stumps, gently pushes it back to the bowler
short and wide to start, carved to deep point from the crease
dances down and drives back to the bowler
flatter delivery on off, Dickwella goes back and punches through extra cover elegantly. His timing has been exceptional so far
flatter, closer to off but de Silva lets the ball come onto him before steering the ball to deep point. All wrists in that stroke
sees Dickwella coming, shortens the length and Dickwella has to improvise a defensive stroke
86 kph, tossed up on middle, swept down to short fine leg
79 kph, flat on off, pushed back
78 kph, long-hop. De Silva reads the length early, jumps back and nails his pull to deep midwicket. Shot.
not nearly short enough to pull but so slow is this surface that Dickwella goes back and lofts the ball over square leg with a well-timed pull. Easy as ...
use of the feet this time, runs to the pitch to convert a flighted delivery into a  full toss, drag-heaves this past midwicket for a couple more
four more. Runs leaking. Flat on middle and leg, Dickwella gets low and places his sweep into the gap at backward square leg. Sensational batting
runs to the pitch and drives to long-on.
short on off, helped along to deep square leg
clipped to deep midwicket. Full enough to play against the turn
nice pace. Not too slow, not too quick. Dickwella goes back, misses his flick and is struck on the thigh pad down leg
bunted back, full length
may have been the googly, whipped to square leg
tossed up on leg, worked to deep midwicket. Five riskfree runs of the over
mis-timed but gets enough to clear mid-on. May have been the offcutter and so it skews off the inside half as de Silva wanted to go straight. A couple more
full just outside off, blocked back
thwacked away. Good length on off and middle, de Silva could have got behind the line to defend. He doesn't want to. Heaves the ball over midwicket. No one deep. Clever shot
slower ball outside off, a lofted whip over midwicket. Dragged it almost, but was helped by a shuffle towards off
full on off, 122 kph. Head over the ball as he defends
goes wider of the crease, 122 kph, close to off, de Silva blocks
leg side-ish, worked to deep square leg
flat, short, straight. Pushed to deep midwicket. De Silva walks the run
use of the feet, converts the flight into a full toss and pushes to long-on
tossed up on off, bat close to pad as de Silva defends
flat and wide outside off, de Silva defends again
quicker outside off, 85 kph. Blocked back
full delivery outside off, 123 kph. Steered to point where Williams dives to his left to stop runs

and taken! Dickwella doesn't get fifty. Short of a length on off or just outside off. Dickwella shimmies down, plays a cross-bat hoick, takes a thick leading edge which flies down to third man. The fielder runs in and gets underneath the ball with a slide and takes a chest-high catch on the ground.
yorker on off, pushed down to long-on
full and straight, 125 kph. Defends to mid-on
126 kph, a half-volley on off. Mendis drills his drive past  his partner. Mid-on puts in a futile dive to his left. Four to the long-on boundary
short delivery outside off, Mendis sways away
shortish and wide outside off, a flayed cut to point
overpitched on off, driven to long-off with the spin. De Silva gets to his highest ODI score
tossed up on leg and middle, driven to cover
86 kph, flat delivery outside off, outside-halved to point
84 kph, pushed away towards cover with the spin
that's a poor ball. Drops short on off, Mendis picks the length early, goes deep in his crease and pulls emphatically over midwicket. Just clears the boundary. Clean strike
slower offcutter on off, squirted to midwicket who dives to his left, tumbles over
good length on off, pushed back past the bowler for a run to mid-off who dives to his right

125 kph, that will be it. Full delivery on off and middle, Mendis looked to go straight but skewed the ball off the inside edge, the ball finds the gap at midwicket and the two runs required is completed.
